channel.title: CVE Feed for Melapress -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Melapress -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-4974|2024-10-16T06:43:30.014Z -- melapress -- activity%20log%20for%20mainwp
item.description: The Freemius SDK, as used by hundreds of WordPress plugin and theme developers, was vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery and Information disclosure due to missing capability checks and nonce protection on the _get_debug_log, _get_db_option, and the _set_db_option functions in versions up to, and including 2.4.2. Any WordPress plugin or theme running a version of Freemius less than 2.4.3 is vulnerable.

item.title: CVE-2024-35650|2024-06-10T17:03:08.459Z -- melapress -- melapress%20login%20security
item.description: Improper Control of Filename for Include/Require Statement in PHP Program ('PHP Remote File Inclusion') vulnerability in Melapress MelaPress Login Security allows PHP Remote File Inclusion.This issue affects MelaPress Login Security: from n/a through 1.3.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-1717|2024-06-04T18:01:05.686Z -- melapress -- admin%20notices%20manager
item.description: The Admin Notices Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the handle_ajax_call() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to retrieve a list of registered user emails.

item.title: CVE-2024-1717|2024-08-01T18:48:21.978Z -- melapress -- admin%20notices%20manager
item.description: The Admin Notices Manager plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized access of data due to a missing capability check on the handle_ajax_call() function in all versions up to, and including, 1.4.0. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber-level access and above, to retrieve a list of registered user emails.

item.title: CVE-2024-35650|2024-08-02T03:14:53.659Z -- melapress -- melapress%20login%20security
item.description: Improper Control of Filename for Include/Require Statement in PHP Program ('PHP Remote File Inclusion') vulnerability in Melapress MelaPress Login Security allows PHP Remote File Inclusion.This issue affects MelaPress Login Security: from n/a through 1.3.0.
